verses.verse: The word <S%H1697><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> came <S%H1961><s%> to Jonah <S%H3124><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Amittai <S%H573><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>

"Arise, <S%H6965><s%> go <S%H1980><s%> to Nineveh <S%H5210><s%> the great <S%H1419><s%> city, <S%H5892><s%> and cry <S%H7121><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> it, for their wickedness <S%H9567><s%> has come <S%H5927><s%> up before <S%H6440><s%> Me."

But Jonah <S%H3124><s%> rose <S%H6965><s%> up to flee <S%H1272><s%> to Tarshish <S%H8659><s%> from the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the Lord. <S%H3068><s%> So he went <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to Joppa, <S%H3305><s%> found <S%H4672><s%> a ship <S%H591><s%> which was going <S%H935><s%> to Tarshish, <S%H8659><s%> paid <S%H5414><s%> the fare, <S%H7939><s%> and went <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> into it to go <S%H935><s%> with them to Tarshish <S%H8659><s%> from the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> hurled <S%H2904><s%> a great <S%H1419><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> on the sea <S%H3220><s%> and there was a great <S%H1419><s%> storm <S%H5591><s%> on the sea <S%H3220><s%> so that the ship <S%H591><s%> was about to break <S%H7665><s%> up.

Then the sailors <S%H4419><s%> became <S%H3372><s%> afraid, <S%H3372><s%> and every <S%H376><s%> man <S%H376><s%> cried <S%H2199><s%> to his god, <S%H430><s%> and they threw <S%H2904><s%> the cargo <S%H3627><s%> which <S%H834><s%> was in the ship <S%H591><s%> into the sea <S%H3220><s%> to lighten <S%H7043><s%> [it] for them. But Jonah <S%H3124><s%> had gone <S%H3381><s%> below <S%H3381><s%> into the hold <S%H3411><s%> of the ship, <S%H5600><s%> lain <S%H7901><s%> down, <S%H7901><s%> and fallen <S%H7290><s%> sound <S%H7290><s%> asleep. <S%H7290><s%>

So the captain <S%H9538><s%> <S%H2259><s%> approached <S%H7126><s%> him and said, <S%H559><s%> "How <S%H4100><s%> is it that you are sleeping <S%H7290><s%>? Get <S%H6965><s%> up, call <S%H7121><s%> on your god. <S%H430><s%> Perhaps <S%H194><s%> [your] god <S%H430><s%> will be concerned <S%H9440><s%> about us so that we will not perish."

And each <S%H376><s%> man <S%H376><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to his mate, <S%H7453><s%> "Come, <S%H1980><s%> let us cast <S%H5307><s%> lots <S%H1486><s%> so we may learn <S%H3045><s%> on whose <S%H4310><s%> account <S%H7945><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> calamity <S%H9567><s%> [has struck] us." So they cast <S%H5307><s%> lots <S%H1486><s%> and the lot <S%H1486><s%> fell <S%H5307><s%> on Jonah. <S%H3124><s%>

Then they said <S%H559><s%> to him, "Tell <S%H5046><s%> us, now! <S%H4994><s%> On whose <S%H4310><s%> account [has] this <S%H2088><s%> calamity <S%H9567><s%> [struck] us? What <S%H4100><s%> is your occupation <S%H4399><s%>? And where <S%H370><s%> do you come <S%H935><s%> from? What <S%H4100><s%> is your country <S%H776><s%>? From what <S%H335><s%> <S%H2088><s%> people <S%H5971><s%> are you?"

And he said <S%H559><s%> to them, "I am a Hebrew, <S%H5680><s%> and I fear <S%H3372><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of heaven <S%H8064><s%> who <S%H834><s%> made <S%H6213><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%> and the dry <S%H3004><s%> land. <S%H3004><s%>"

Then the men <S%H376><s%> became <S%H3372><s%> extremely <S%H3374><s%> <S%H1419><s%> frightened <S%H3372><s%> and they said <S%H559><s%> to him, "How <S%H4100><s%> could you do <S%H6213><s%> this <S%H2088><s%>?" For the men <S%H376><s%> knew <S%H3045><s%> that he was fleeing <S%H1272><s%> from the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> he had told <S%H5046><s%> them.

So they said <S%H559><s%> to him, "What <S%H4100><s%> should we do <S%H6213><s%> to you that the sea <S%H3220><s%> may become <S%H8367><s%> calm <S%H8367><s%> for us?" â€“ for the sea <S%H3220><s%> was becoming <S%H1980><s%> increasingly <S%H1980><s%> stormy. <S%H5590><s%>

And he said <S%H559><s%> to them, "Pick <S%H5375><s%> me up and throw <S%H2904><s%> me into the sea. <S%H3220><s%> Then the sea <S%H3220><s%> will become <S%H8367><s%> calm <S%H8367><s%> for you, for I know <S%H3045><s%> that on account <S%H7945><s%> of me this <S%H2088><s%> great <S%H1419><s%> storm <S%H5591><s%> [has come] upon you."

However, the men <S%H376><s%> rowed <S%H2864><s%> [desperately] to return <S%H7725><s%> to land <S%H3004><s%> but they could <S%H3201><s%> not, for the sea <S%H3220><s%> was becoming <S%H1980><s%> [even] stormier <S%H5590><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> them.

Then they called <S%H7121><s%> on the Lord <S%H3068><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "We earnestly <S%H577><s%> pray, <S%H577><s%> O <S%H577><s%> Lord, <S%H3068><s%> do not let us perish on account of this <S%H6><s%> man's life <S%H2088><s%> and do not put <S%H5315><s%> innocent <S%H5414><s%> blood <S%H5355><s%> on us; for Thou, O Lord, <S%H1818><s%> hast done <S%H3068><s%> as Thou hast pleased. <S%H6213><s%>"
So they picked <S%H5375><s%> up Jonah, <S%H3124><s%> threw <S%H2904><s%> him into the sea, <S%H3220><s%> and the sea <S%H3220><s%> stopped <S%H5975><s%> its raging. <S%H2197><s%>

Then the men <S%H376><s%> feared <S%H3372><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> greatly, <S%H1419><s%> and they offered <S%H2076><s%> a sacrifice <S%H2077><s%> to the Lord <S%H3068><s%> and made <S%H5087><s%> vows. <S%H5088><s%>

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> appointed <S%H4487><s%> a great <S%H1419><s%> fish <S%H1709><s%> to swallow <S%H1104><s%> Jonah, <S%H3124><s%> and Jonah <S%H3124><s%> was in the stomach <S%H4578><s%> of the fish <S%H1709><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> and three <S%H7969><s%> nights. <S%H3915><s%>
